data.title: Winter Festival Guide 2023/2024
data.meta_description: Cure your summer blues with our pick of festivals coming up this winter
data.text:
As we approach the end of another year and move into the cold winter months, it can be tricky to keep that party spirit alive. However, we’ve handpicked a selection of festivals and events from around the world for you to enjoy over the winter period. From day events in Europe to week long festivals in exotic locations, we have something for everyone.

FAIRGROUND FESTIVAL

December 1st & 2nd

Hannover, Germany

Held across two days with three floors of stages housed inside Hannover Messe, Fairground is one of Germany’s biggest indoor festivals, serving up a variety of electronic music’s leading names with one day dedicated to special live performances only. The likes of Paul Kalkbrenner, Stephan Bodzin, Artbat, Camelphat, Franky Wah among others are set to perform.

Contact Festival 2023

December 2nd

Munich, Germany

Looking for something a bit heavier and just for one day only? Contact has you covered. Utilising two adjacent venues in the vibrant city of Munich, this day festival features spellbinding production and stage design complemented by a stacked lineup of techno tastemakers such as 999999999, Nico Moreno, Paula Temple B2B SNTS, I Hate Models, KI/KI and more.

Art With ME Miami

December 8th-10th

Miami, USA

Fancy something further afield packed with extra activities like wellness sessions and art installations? Art With Me in Miami could be just what you want. Taking place in the Historic Virginia Key Beach Park, this three day spectacle is just minutes from downtown Miami and boasts over 40 acts including Underworld, Damian Lazarus, Lee Burridge, Polo & Pan and more.

MDLBEAST – SOUNDSTORM 2023

December 16-19th

Riyadh, Saudi Arabia

US and Europe not cutting it for ya? How about Saudi Arabia then? This December MDLBEAST are back with another edition of Soundstorm, with an all-star billing of artists. Performing for four days from 16th – 19th December will see Adam Beyer, Armin Van Buuren, Carl Cox, Deadmau5 and many more with options for luxury package options if you’re looking to indulge.

Burning Beach Bali

December 22nd & 23rd

Nusa Dua, Bali

After something more exotic? Look no further – Bali’s Burning Beach is renowned as the go-to underground music festival in the region and this year’s line-up is its biggest yet, with a mix of industry legends and rising stars. Taking place at the gorgeous Mari Beach Club which is in the heart of Bali’s nightlife, Burning Beach Festival is the ultimate two-day celebration of house and techno music in an idyllic location.

Labryinto

December 27th – January 2nd

Guanacaste Province, Costa Rica

If you’re still planning what to do for New Year’s, this could be the one for you. Labryinto is a week long experience which blends art, music and community with an agenda packed full of activities alongside performances from Black Coffee, Adriatique, ANOTR, Carlita and Denis Cruz just to name a few.

Beyond The Valley

December 28th – 1st Jan

Victoria, Australia

Always wanted to go to Australia? Here’s something which will make the trip even more worthwhile. Marking their their eighth edition, Beyond The Valley is back this December 28th until 1st January at Barunah Plains – a picturesque haven located on the lands of the Wadawurrung & Eastern Marr. Boasting a natural amphitheatre, the plains are complemented by bespoke architecturally designed stages and state-of-the-art sound/production with a jaw-dropping lineup to boot.

Forever Midnight LA

December 30th – 31st

Los Angeles, USA

Another option to see out 2023 and end the year on a high note is new house and techno festival; Forever Midnight LA. The two day event held on the US west coast at Los Angles Convention Center features performances from Solomun, Eric Prydz, hometown hero Masha Mar, Kaytranada as well as a must see back-to-back from Jamie Jones and The Martinez Brothers.

Ocaso Festival

January 4th-8th, 2024

Guanacaste, Costa Rica

Kick off the year with some sun, sea and beats at Ocaso Festival in Guanacaste. This tropical utopia which is filled with vibrant culture and pristine beaches makes for a stunning backdrop to enjoy the sounds of Hannah Wants, John Summit, Seth Troxler, Mind Against and a whole lot more for five days of paradise.

Day Zero Tulum 2024

January 12th, 2024

Tulum, Mexico

Tulum’s annual Day Zero party is back this January 12th and is bringing with it yet another stellar lineup. Founded by Damian Lazarus, the event has become a staple in many ravers diaries offering a unique experience held in the jungle of Tulum. Artists set to play include Skream, Patrick Mason, DJ Tennis, WhoMadeWho and Acid Pauli.
